page.title: 05FARMING - 1 DOE PARK FARM
page.content: {Doe Park Farm, Cotherstone}is a stock farm of 205 acres situated on the main road between Cotherstone and Romaldkirk. The house was built by the Ledgard family between 1650 & 1685 & is on the style of a manor house (Photo D). The land (80 acres grass 15 acres wood, 100 acres pasture, 6 acres arable) is unusually flat for the area & mainly given over to grass for grazing & hay,with 6 acres of feed for use on the farm. 35 suckler cows, mainly Friesan & Hereford bull produce Hereford & Friesan calves. Further calves are bought in & a double suckler system operated. Some calves are bred using AI & produce Limousan and Charolais calves. The calves are reared for 1 year & sold for further fattening.
